entry.tran: （尤指战争期间或陆上交通中断时的）空运
entry.def: An airlift is an operation to move people, troops, or goods by air, especially in a war or when land routes are closed.

example.ex: President Garcia has ordered an airlift of food, medicines and blankets.
example.tran: 加西亚总统已经下令空运食品、药物和毛毯。

entry.def: If people, troops, or goods are airlifted somewhere, they are carried by air, especially in a war or when land routes are closed.

example.ex: The injured were airlifted to hospital in Prestwick...
example.tran: 伤者被空运送往普雷斯特维克的医院。

example.ex: Other nationalities, such as Pakistanis, were being airlifted out by their governments...
example.tran: 其他国家的人，例如巴基斯坦人，正由本国政府空运出境。

means.word_mean: 1. transportation of people or goods by air (especially when other means of access are unavailable)
1. fly people or goods to or from places not accessible by other means;

auth_sentence.content: First airlift of UN aid in five years arrives in Mogadishu.
auth_sentence.res_content: First airlift of UN aid in five years arrives in Mogadishu.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: First airlift of UN aid in five years arrives in Mogadishu.

auth_sentence.content: The UNHCR began an emergency airlift of basic relief supplies a week ago.
auth_sentence.res_content: The UNHCR began an emergency airlift of basic relief supplies a week ago.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The UNHCR began an emergency airlift of basic relief supplies a week ago.

auth_sentence.content: The ECB may also need to airlift a few million extra banknotes to Nicosia.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ECB may also need to airlift a few million extra banknotes to Nicosia.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ECB may also need to airlift a few million extra banknotes to Nicosia.

sentences.en: The government ordered an airlift of medical and food supplies to the disaster area because the roads were destroyed.
sentences.cn: 由于公路被毁，政府命令向受灾地区空运药品和食品。

sentences.en: The nurse had been airlifted to Kinshasa.
sentences.cn: 这位护士被用飞机送到金沙萨。
